獌獌獌

獌字的基本解释

獌
màn
古书上说的一种狼一类的野兽，像狸。

獌字的汉语字典释义

[①]［màn］
［《廣韻》莫半切，去换，明。］
［《廣韻》莫還切，平删，明。］
［《廣韻》無販切，去願，微。］
亦作“1”。亦作“1”。亦作“1”。
兽名。似狸，狼属。《尔雅·释兽》：“貙獌似貍。”郝懿行义疏：“貙、獌非二物也。《釋文》引《字林》：'獌，狼屬，一曰貙'是矣。”《说文·犬部》：“獌，狼屬。”段玉裁注：“《釋獸》曰：'貙似貍'，郭云：'今貙虎也，大如狗，文似貍。'《釋獸》又曰：'貙似貍。'郭云：'今山民呼貙虎之大者爲貙豻。'按，郭語則二條一物也。”《宋书·谢灵运传》：“山上則猨、、狸、獾、犴、獌、猰。”原注：“獌，似獾而長，狼之屬，一曰貙。”唐柳宗元《酬韶州裴曹长使君寄道州吕八大使因以见示二十韵》：“泥沙潛虺蜮，榛莽鬭豺獌。”童宗说注：“﹝獌﹞，狼屬，似狸。”一说虎属。

獌字的康熙字典解释

【巳集下】【犬字部】　獌； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页717第18
【唐韻】舞販切【集韻】無販切，?音萬。【說文】狼屬也。【廣韻】獌狿，獸長百尋。【爾雅·釋獸】貙獌，似貍。【疏】字林云：貙似貍而大，一名獌。【廣韻】或作䝡。【集韻】通作蟃。　又【廣韻】【集韻】?莫半切，音縵。義同。【廣韻】或作䝢。【集韻】亦作䝡。　又【廣韻】母官切【集韻】謨官切，?音瞞。義同。【集韻】或作?䝡。

獌字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
獌字的起名意思

暂无。

Roan
Basic explanation of words
Roan
màn
A wolf-like beast in ancient books, like a raccoon dog.
Roan
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［màn］
["Guang Yun" don't cut it in half, change it, Ming. ]
["Guangyun" Do not cut it, delete it plainly, and make it clear. ]
["Guangyun" no sales cut, go to wish, micro. ]
Also known as "1". Also known as "1". Also known as "1".
Animal name. Like a raccoon dog, a wolf genus. "Erya · Shi Beast": "The scorpion is like a raccoon." Hao Yixing's commentary: "The scorpion and the scorpion are not two things." Shi Wen" quotes the "Zi Lin":'The scorpion is the genus of the wolf, and the other is the scorpion.' "Shuowen·Dog Department": "The scorpion, the wolf is the genus." Duan Yucai's note: ""Shi Beast" said:'Bao is like a raccoon.' Guo Yun:'Nowadays, the tiger is as big as a dog, and the text is like a raccoon. "Shi Beast" also said: "Hua is like a raccoon dog." Guo Yun: "The mountain people call the tiger is the big tiger." Press, Guo Yu has two articles and one thing." "Song Shu·Xie Lingyun "Biography": "On the mountain, there are 猨, , raccoon, badger, 犴, 猰, and 猰." Original note: "The 猨, grows like a badger, and belongs to the wolf, and one is called a scorpion." Tang Liu Zongyuan "Remuneration to Shaozhou Cao Cao Chang. The ambassador of Junji Daozhou Lvba shows twenty rhymes because of seeing it.": "Sand lurking with mythical creatures, hazelnuts and jackals." Tong Zong said note: "﹝獌﹞, wolf genus, like raccoon dog." One said tiger genus. .
